H0.text: what material was used to build the roofs of houses in burzahom. Deodar

H1.text: what material was used to build the roofs of houses in burzahom. Bamboo

H2.text: what material was used to build the roofs of houses in burzahom. Pine

H3.text: what material was used to build the roofs of houses in burzahom. birch

A4.text: Post holes on the sides of pits at the surface level denoted the presence of superstructures covered with thatch made of birch.

A5.text: In the Kashmiri language 'Burz' means 'birch', a tree species (that generally grows in the elevation range of 3,000 to 4,200 metres (9,800 to 13,800 ft) in the Himalayas), which is found in the excavated housing area in the form of roofing material, and thus confirming the existence of the tree even in the pre-historic Neolithic times.
